detaileddescription.para: Connecting to Azure IoT Hub. The event has no associated data.
Connected to Azure IoT Hub. The event has no associated data.
Connection attempt failed. The reported error code from the IoT Hub is available in the data.err member in the event structure. The error codes correspond to return codes in MQTT CONNACK messages.
Azure IoT Hub connection established and ready to receive data. The event has no associated data.
Disconnected from Azure IoT Hub. The event has no associated data.

Device-bound data received from Azure IoT Hub. The event contains the received data in the data.msg member, and the topic it was received on in the topic member, including message properties in topic.properties.
Acknowledgment for data sent to Azure IoT Hub. The acknowledged message ID is in data.message_id.
Acknowledgment for ping request message sent to Azure IoT Hub. The event has no associated data.
Device twin has been received. The event contains the received data in the data.msg member, and the topic it was received on in the topic member, including message properties in topic.properties.

Device twin has received a desired property update. The event contains the received data in the data.msg member, and the topic it was received on in the topic member, including message properties in topic.properties.

Device twin update successful. The request ID and status are contained in the data.result member of the event structure. The received payload is in the data.msg member, and the topic it was received on is in the topic member.
Device twin update failed. The request ID and status are contained in the data.result member of the event structure.

Direct method invoked from the cloud side. The event contains the method data in the ``data.method`` member, and the topic it was received on in the ``topic`` member.
@note After a direct method has been executed, @a azure_iot_hub_method_respond must be called to report back the result of the method invocation.
FOTA download starting. The event has no associated data.
FOTA update done, reboot required to apply update. The event has no associated data.
FOTA erase pending. On nRF9160-based devices this is typically caused by an active LTE connection preventing erase operation. The event has no associated data.
FOTA erase done. The event has no associated data.
FOTA failed. The event has no associated data.
A received message is too large for the payload buffer and can not be processed. The event has no associated data.
Internal library error. The event has no associated data.

briefdescription.para: Azure IoT Hub notification events used to notify the user.

detaileddescription.para: Data received on the devicebound topic.
Data received on the direct method topic.
Received "desired" properties from the device twin.
Topic to receive twin request result messages. Both success and error messages are received on the same topic.
Topic to receive Device Provisioning Service (DPS) messages.
Event topic used to send event data to Azure IoT Hub.
Send updates to the "reported" properties in the device twin.
Topic to request to receive the device twin.
Indicates that the message was received on an unknown topic.

briefdescription.para: Azure IoT Hub topic type, used to route messages to the correct destination.
Azure IoT Hub library event handler.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to event structure.

simplesect.para: This API must be called exactly once, and it must return successfully for subsequent calls to this library to succeed.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to event handler function.
If successful.
if the library has already been initialized and is in a state where it can not be re-initialized.
in invalid argument was provided.

briefdescription.para: Establish connection to Azure IoT Hub. The function blocks until a connection to the hub is established on the transport level. Subsequent calls to other library function should await AZURE_IOT_HUB_EVT_CONNECTED and AZURE_IOT_HUB_EVT_READY events.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to struct containing connection parameters. If NULL, values from Kconfig will be used instead.
If successful.
if the device is already connected to an IoT Hub.
if an connection attempt is already in progress.
if the library is not in disconnected state.
if the provided configuration is invalid.
if the provided device ID is larger than the internal buffer size.
if there was an internal error in the library.

briefdescription.para: Disconnect from Azure IoT Hub. Calling this function initiates the disconnection procedure, and the event AZURE_IOT_HUB_EVT_DISCONNECTED is received when it is completed.

parameterdescription.para: If successful.
if the device is not connected to an IoT Hub.
if the MQTT library reported an error.

briefdescription.para: Send data to Azure IoT Hub.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to struct containing data to be transmitted to Azure IoT Hub.
If successful.
if a NULL pointer was provided.
if the provided message topic was invalid.
an internal buffer is too small to hold the topic data. This can for instance happen if message properties are in use, as they are appended to the topic.
if the device is not connected to an IoT Hub.
if the request ID buffer was insufficient to create the ID.
if there was an internal error in the library.

briefdescription.para: Send response to a direct method invoked from the cloud.

parameterdescription.para: Structure containing result data from the direct method execution.
If successful.
if a NULL pointer was provided.
if there was no iot hub connection.
if there was an error when creating the response message.
if the MQTT library reported an error when publishing the response.
